name: Acetaminophen
dosage: 500 mg every 4–6 hours as needed (do not exceed 3,000 mg/day without medical advice)
warnings: Avoid overdose; may harm the liver. Alcohol increases risk.

name: Ibuprofen
warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach irritation. Avoid if history of ulcers.

name: Aspirin
warnings: Not for children with viral illness (Reye's syndrome).

name: Amoxicillin
dosage: As prescribed (commonly 500 mg three times daily)
warnings: Complete full course. Notify if allergic to penicillin.

name: Diphenhydramine
dosage: 25–50 mg at night for sleep; follow package for allergies
warnings: Do not combine with alcohol or other sedatives

name: Albuterol
dosage: As inhaler label directs (e.g., 2 puffs every 4–6 hours)
warnings: Use rescue inhaler only as directed

name: Metformin
uses: Blood sugar control for type 2 diabetes
dosage: Typically 500–1000 mg twice daily as prescribed
warnings: Monitor kidney function; avoid excessive alcohol

name: Omeprazole
warnings: Long-term use may affect nutrient absorption

name: Simvastatin
warnings: Monitor for muscle pain and interactions with grapefruit

name: Prednisone
warnings: Do not stop abruptly after long-term use

name: Loperamide
dosage: Follow package instructions (commonly 4 mg initial, then 2 mg after each loose stool)
warnings: Not for bloody diarrhea or high fever

name: Fluoxetine
dosage: As prescribed; commonly 20 mg once daily
warnings: Watch for mood changes; interacts with other serotonergic drugs

name: Nitroglycerin
dosage: Follow prescriber's instructions; sublingual for acute chest pain
warnings: Do not use with PDE5 inhibitors (e.g., sildenafil)
